Tonga has three Covid-19 testing machines, 2 purchased and one donated by WHO. The testing lab is on Tongatapu.  To date testing appears to be primarily directed to repatriation flights, although it is now also available for a fee for departing passengers.  Although borders are closed to international travellers, since October a number of flights have departed for seasonal workers to Australia and Tasmania.  These workers will presumably need a negative Covid-19 test certificate for travel.    Following the coding rules for H2 the decision is made to leave this at "1" on the basis that three machines  may not offer the capacity for widespread testing of symptomatic or asymptomatic individuals.

The first suspected case of Covid-19 occurred on 4th March.  Descriptions of the response to this case suggested that it may have been quite comprehensive and could have been coded as a "2" (comprehensive).  To date however, with borders closed, no confirmed cases and strict quarantine requirements for repatriating flights, the contact tracing response has not to date been tested.  Following the coding rules, it has not been possible to assess the capacity of contact tracing and so a code of "1" was chosen to reflect at minimum that detailed contact tracing is employed in some cases.
